articles.headline: Venezuela’s Strongman Was Confident of Victory. Then Came the Shock.
articles.snippet: Venezuela’s government believed its control of all levers of power would give the country’s authoritarian president an Election Day victory. A rebellion by its supporters undid the plan.
articles.abstract: Venezuela’s government believed its control of all levers of power would give the country’s authoritarian president an Election Day victory. A rebellion by its supporters undid the plan.
articles.lead_paragraph: For the Venezuelan government, everything seemed to be falling in place.

articles.headline: In Walz, Harris Sees a Battleground Strategy Dressed in Carhartt
articles.snippet: Democrats think Gov. Tim Walz’s cultural ties are needed to talk to rural and working-class voters. But Republicans are not going to let his folksy style obscure a liberal record.
articles.abstract: Democrats think Gov. Tim Walz’s cultural ties are needed to talk to rural and working-class voters. But Republicans are not going to let his folksy style obscure a liberal record.
articles.lead_paragraph: In selecting Gov. Tim Walz of Minnesota as her running mate, Vice President Kamala Harris has picked a partner who is many things she is not: a product of small-town America. A union member known to campaign in a T-shirt and camo hat. A white guy who exudes Midwestern dad energy.

articles.headline: With ‘Sprint’ and Simone Biles, Netflix Fills Olympic Content Gap
articles.snippet: New seasons of documentaries about running, gymnastics and basketball are being filmed this summer as part of a partnership with the International Olympic Committee.
articles.abstract: New seasons of documentaries about running, gymnastics and basketball are being filmed this summer as part of a partnership with the International Olympic Committee.
articles.lead_paragraph: The four-person crew from Box to Box Films, the production company responsible for the hit Netflix motorsports docuseries “Formula 1: Drive to Survive,” has often shot in lavish settings like Monaco and Miami.

articles.headline: Recession Risks Rise as Consumers Turn Cautious
articles.snippet: Consumer spending has powered the economic recovery from the pandemic shock. Now wallets are thinner, and some businesses are feeling the difference.
articles.abstract: Consumer spending has powered the economic recovery from the pandemic shock. Now wallets are thinner, and some businesses are feeling the difference.
articles.lead_paragraph: The economy’s resurgence from the pandemic shock has had a singular driving force: the consumer. Flush with savings and buoyed by a sizzling labor market, Americans have spent exuberantly, on goods such as furniture and electronics and then on services including air travel and restaurant meals.
articles.byline: By Sydney Ember, Jordyn Holman and Julie Creswell

articles.headline: What’s Behind All the Stock Market Drama?
articles.snippet: Analysts and investors have many explanations, including worries about the health of the U.S. economy and shifts in the value of the Japanese yen.
articles.abstract: Analysts and investors have many explanations, including worries about the health of the U.S. economy and shifts in the value of the Japanese yen.
articles.lead_paragraph: The wild swings in markets recently are a case study in how seemingly distinct pillars around the globe are connected through the financial system — and the domino effect that can follow if one of them falls.
articles.byline: By Joe Rennison and Danielle Kaye

articles.headline: Disney’s Parks Struggle, Exposing a New Trouble Spot
articles.snippet: Companywide profit increased, the result of hit movies and streaming growth. But Disney said softening theme park demand “could impact the next few quarters.”
articles.abstract: Companywide profit increased, the result of hit movies and streaming growth. But Disney said softening theme park demand “could impact the next few quarters.”
articles.lead_paragraph: In Disney’s seemingly never-ending game of corporate Whac-a-Mole, a new trouble spot has arisen: Americans — battered by years of high inflation — have less money to spend on amusement, imperiling growth at Disney theme parks.

articles.headline: Trump Dangles New Tax Cut Proposals With Real Political Appeal
articles.snippet: The most recent and costliest of Mr. Trump’s ideas would end income taxes on Social Security benefits.
articles.abstract: The most recent and costliest of Mr. Trump’s ideas would end income taxes on Social Security benefits.
articles.lead_paragraph: First it was a tax cut for hotel and restaurant workers in Nevada, a swing state where Donald J. Trump proposed exempting tips from taxes. Then, in front of powerful chief executives gathered in Washington, Mr. Trump floated cutting the corporate tax rate, helping to ease concerns in the business community about his candidacy.
